immediate_apply.subsidy_amount: 25% to 33.33% of project cost (Maximum Rs 1 crore)
key_benefits: Up to Rs 1 crore subsidy for storage infrastructure
No land size restrictions - all farmers eligible
Supports scientific storage and marketing facilities
next_steps: Step 1: Prepare detailed project report for storage/marketing infrastructure
Step 2: Approach eligible financial institution (Bank/SFC) for term loan
Step 3: Submit project report with cost estimates to bank

immediate_apply.scheme_name: Agri Clinics and Agri Business Centres (ACABC)
immediate_apply.subsidy_amount: 36% (General) to 44% (SC/ST/Women/NER) of project cost (Maximum Rs 25 lakh)
key_benefits: Up to Rs 25 lakh subsidy for agri-business setup
Higher 44% subsidy for women, SC/ST, NER candidates
Professional training provided before business setup
next_steps: Step 1: Complete agriculture degree/diploma or document practical experience
Step 2: Prepare business plan for agri-clinic/business center
Step 3: Register at nearest ACABC training institute

immediate_apply.subsidy_amount: Low interest loans to state governments (benefit passes to farmers)
key_benefits: Improved rural roads connecting farms to markets
Better irrigation facilities through minor irrigation projects
Enhanced connectivity reducing transportation costs
next_steps: Step 1: State government identifies rural infrastructure needs
Step 2: Prepare detailed project proposals with cost estimates
Step 3: Submit proposals to NABARD through State Planning Department

immediate_apply.subsidy_amount: Low cost funds to states for farmer subsidies on drip/sprinkler irrigation
key_benefits: Access to subsidized drip and sprinkler irrigation systems
Significant water savings (40-60% water conservation)
Higher crop yields with efficient water use
next_steps: Step 1: State identifies areas needing micro irrigation expansion
Step 2: State prepares comprehensive micro irrigation expansion plan
Step 3: Submit detailed proposal to NABARD with cost estimates

immediate_apply.subsidy_amount: 3% interest subvention on crop loans up to Rs 3 lakh
key_benefits: Significant reduction in crop loan interest rates
Additional 3% reduction for prompt repayment
Available through all banks automatically
next_steps: Step 1: Approach any scheduled bank for crop loan
Step 2: Submit loan application with required documents
Step 3: Bank processes loan as per normal procedures

consider_applying.subsidy_amount: 50% of project cost up to Rs 50 lakh maximum
key_benefits: Up to Rs 50 lakh subsidy for livestock entrepreneurship
85% insurance premium support (farmer pays only 15%)
Breed improvement support for all animals
next_steps: Step 1: Visit nlm.udyamimitra.in for online application
Step 2: Select appropriate sub-mission (breed development/feed development/skill development)
Step 3: Fill application form with livestock details and project plan

consider_applying.subsidy_amount: 3% interest subvention per annum + 25% credit guarantee for MSMEs
key_benefits: Rs 29,610 crore fund for animal husbandry infrastructure
3% interest subvention reducing loan costs significantly
25% credit guarantee for MSMEs reducing collateral requirements
next_steps: Step 1: Visit ahidf.udyamimitra.in for online application
Step 2: Register as entrepreneur/organization on the portal
Step 3: Select project category (dairy/meat/feed/vaccines etc.)

consider_applying.subsidy_amount: 40% for general category, 60% for SC/ST/Women of unit cost
key_benefits: Rs 20,050 crore investment in fisheries sector development
60% subsidy for SC/ST/Women vs 40% for others
Complete value chain support from production to marketing
next_steps: Step 1: Visit pmmsy.dof.gov.in for scheme guidelines and application
Step 2: Identify suitable activity (aquaculture/marine/infrastructure/marketing)
Step 3: Prepare detailed project report with cost estimates

Subsidies as per state guidelines
Technical support from state agriculture department
